name: Bamboo Lagoon Backwater Front Resort

reviews.text: Excellent in all respects. Lovely room. Right on the backwaters. Great walk around the rice fields recommended by the manager. Took a four hour trip on their boat which was excellent. We had lunch and dinner and two breakfast all of which were excellent. Stay here.
reviews.title: Ten out of ten

reviews.text: It was an interesting experience staying at the Bamboo Lagoon. The home stay is located on an island nestled between other home steads on the water front. We tried a walk around the island however all paths link various homesteads. The Bamboo Lagoon was remarkably civilized considering the location. There was air con and running water and a flat screen TV. Currently the home stead has three rooms however they are building a two story block to accommodate more people. Dinner was an adventure with the ravenous mosquitoes wanting a piece of the action. You need to have your own entertainment as there is nothing to do on the islands other than watch boats sail by.
reviews.title: House in the Jungle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is right on the back waters and we definitely did not miss not taking a house boat! The 3-room guesthouse is a small yet pretty property. They are now adding 4 rooms there. You actually reach the place by a boat steered by an old and friendly man.
reviews.title: On the back waters, a small yet pretty place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are small but very neat and clean. I loved the architecture, very traditional and homely. They have 2 hammocks where you can read and chill out. Sharad, our caretaker was extremely helpful and made our stay comfortable! The food was delectable, home made Kerala traditional food. On our request, we were served on banana leaves and the experience was nice
reviews.title: Excellent hospitality at this backwater resort

reviews.text: We were extremely happy with our decision to stay at Bamboo Lagoon backwater resort. The location of this resort is away from the crowded city, in the middle of an island, main backwaters and one can easily take a trip around Alleppey backwaters.
reviews.title: natural feeling at affordable front

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at bamboo lagoon for a few days. the place is very small and in a very good spot on the edge of the backwaters near punnamada lake. our room was nice and clean and we had some great food here. we really enjoyed our stay here, and Charad really helped make it. A lovely guy who is a real asset to bamboo lagoon. he was happy to try and organise anything we wanted without the feeling that he was hassling us. the place is building 3 more rooms on the 3 it currently has, i m sure it will be just as nice and friendly once this happens, however will depend heavily on Charad staying there as he made our stay very comfortable.
reviews.title: friendly spot on the backwaters edge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We initially thought this place was some kind of resort, and planned to have a night or two there before heading onto the back waters. It had some good reviews and looking at the pictures it seemed like Karl Pilkington himself had stayed there.
reviews.title: A very peaceful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the boarding point and took a canoe over to the other side of the river and were greeted by the manager who showed us to our room. The room was fairly basic but clean and reasonably priced at 1500 Rs. The location though was perfect, overlooking the back waters and watching all of the boats pass from the comfort of a hammock in the nicely maintained gardens.
reviews.title: excellent stay

reviews.text: We ate in the hotel that evening, chicken curry with chapattis and a couple of beers and it was delicious home cooked food.
reviews.title: Blissful!

reviews.text: The manager was very attentive and actually couldn't do enough for us. If your looking for a quiet place to recharge your batteries then I would highly recommend staying here!
reviews.title: very pretty and quiet place

reviews.text: Bamboo lagoon has 3 clean, smart double rooms right on the backwaters. The food was great and we enjoyed a tour of the smaller backwaters which he arranged. The price of everything very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great value place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had planned to stay for 2 nights and booked over the phone but arrived to find that we had only been booked in for one night due to a miscommunication. The owner was very professional about the whole thing and arranged for us to stay at another place on the coast for the same price. He also organised the transport to that place and back the following day for a houseboat, also arranged through him. Everything over those few days ran so smoothly and was probably the least stressful part of my time in India due to his friendly and effective organisation.
reviews.title: Amazing find in Alleppey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend bamboo lagoon as a place to stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic first experience of South India/Kerala.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great experience of the Bamboo resort from start to finish.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked over the phone and were picked up by a super friendly guy who went out of his way to ensure we had a lovely stay. It may be a bit of a trek from Alleppey centre but it was so nice to be away from the hustle and bustle and the family are happy to organise any transport. (not sure how you would find it otherwise!!)
reviews.title: "Tranquil setting on the edge of the backwaters"

reviews.text: A very nice and relaxing homestay. Lovely staff that really took the time for us and gave us the best service that we could ever ask for. It was a lovely experience and memory. I truly recommend this!
reviews.title: Bamboo Lagoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I had a wonderful, relaxing stay at Bamboo Lagoon. The location is beautiful, right on the lake, food was excellent, room very clean and we were so well looked after.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is an excellent location for people who wants peace of mind,lake front rooms,delecious food and more.You need to row for reaching this place and it is located on the edge of lake.The care take Sharath can be reached on --.Food is so tasty and i never forget it.The staff are so friendly.This is not a hotel only home stay,you can choose it for an excellent lake view and delicious food.Overall its a memorable stay for me.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: this is a n excellant peacefull stay enjoy riverfront,greenary and canoying ideal for family and couples ,very good service and local taste
reviews.title: place for peacefull stay

aka: Bamboo Lagoon Backwater Front Resort Kerala/Alappuzha, India
description: Nestled in the lap of the spectacular Punnamda backwaters in Kerala, Bamboo Lagoon Resort offers basic modern comforts at easily affordable rates. The hotel is ideally located in proximity to the azure Puunnamad River and also offers the exclusive privilege of a house boat cruise where you can have loads of fun all day long. Cochin airport is located at 46 km from Hotel and the nearest railway station is only 5km from the resort.
